info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 08 at 1:19PM EDT until July 08 at 1:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Mecklenburg County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 145 PM EDT. * At 119 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles south of Uptown Charlotte, or over Southpark Mall, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Uptown Charlotte, South Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, East Charlotte, Matthews, Mint Hill, Pineville, Freedom Park, The Plaza and The Arboretum. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
